00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 # Copyright (c) 2012 Google Inc. All rights reserved.
00004 # Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be
00005 # found in the LICENSE file.
00006 
00007 """Pretty-prints the contents of a GYP file."""
00008 
00009 import sys
00010 import re
00011 
00012 
00013 # Regex to remove comments when we're counting braces.
00014 COMMENT_RE = re.compile(r'\s*#.*')
00015 
00016 # Regex to remove quoted strings when we're counting braces.
00017 # It takes into account quoted quotes, and makes sure that the quotes match.
00018 # NOTE: It does not handle quotes that span more than one line, or
00019 # cases where an escaped quote is preceeded by an escaped backslash.
00020 QUOTE_RE_STR = r'(?P<q>[\'"])(.*?)(?<![^\\][\\])(?P=q)'
00021 QUOTE_RE = re.compile(QUOTE_RE_STR)
00022 
00023 
00024 def comment_replace(matchobj):
00025   return matchobj.group(1) + matchobj.group(2) + '#' * len(matchobj.group(3))
00026 
00027 
00028 def mask_comments(input):
00029   """Mask the quoted strings so we skip braces inside quoted strings."""
00030   search_re = re.compile(r'(.*?)(#)(.*)')
00031   return [search_re.sub(comment_replace, line) for line in input]
00032 
00033 
00034 def quote_replace(matchobj):
00035   return "%s%s%s%s" % (matchobj.group(1),
00036                        matchobj.group(2),
00037                        'x'*len(matchobj.group(3)),
00038                        matchobj.group(2))
00039 
00040 
00041 def mask_quotes(input):
00042   """Mask the quoted strings so we skip braces inside quoted strings."""
00043   search_re = re.compile(r'(.*?)' + QUOTE_RE_STR)
00044   return [search_re.sub(quote_replace, line) for line in input]
00045 
00046 
00047 def do_split(input, masked_input, search_re):
00048   output = []
00049   mask_output = []
00050   for (line, masked_line) in zip(input, masked_input):
00051     m = search_re.match(masked_line)
00052     while m:
00053       split = len(m.group(1))
00054       line = line[:split] + r'\n' + line[split:]
00055       masked_line = masked_line[:split] + r'\n' + masked_line[split:]
00056       m = search_re.match(masked_line)
00057     output.extend(line.split(r'\n'))
00058     mask_output.extend(masked_line.split(r'\n'))
00059   return (output, mask_output)
00060 
00061 
00062 def split_double_braces(input):
00063   """Masks out the quotes and comments, and then splits appropriate
00064   lines (lines that matche the double_*_brace re's above) before
00065   indenting them below.
00066 
00067   These are used to split lines which have multiple braces on them, so
00068   that the indentation looks prettier when all laid out (e.g. closing
00069   braces make a nice diagonal line).
00070   """
00071   double_open_brace_re = re.compile(r'(.*?[\[\{\(,])(\s*)([\[\{\(])')
00072   double_close_brace_re = re.compile(r'(.*?[\]\}\)],?)(\s*)([\]\}\)])')
00073 
00074   masked_input = mask_quotes(input)
00075   masked_input = mask_comments(masked_input)
00076 
00077   (output, mask_output) = do_split(input, masked_input, double_open_brace_re)
00078   (output, mask_output) = do_split(output, mask_output, double_close_brace_re)
00079 
00080   return output
00081 
00082 
00083 def count_braces(line):
00084   """keeps track of the number of braces on a given line and returns the result.
00085 
00086   It starts at zero and subtracts for closed braces, and adds for open braces.
00087   """
00088   open_braces = ['[', '(', '{']
00089   close_braces = [']', ')', '}']
00090   closing_prefix_re = re.compile(r'(.*?[^\s\]\}\)]+.*?)([\]\}\)],?)\s*$')
00091   cnt = 0
00092   stripline = COMMENT_RE.sub(r'', line)
00093   stripline = QUOTE_RE.sub(r"''", stripline)
00094   for char in stripline:
00095     for brace in open_braces:
00096       if char == brace:
00097         cnt += 1
00098     for brace in close_braces:
00099       if char == brace:
00100         cnt -= 1
00101 
00102   after = False
00103   if cnt > 0:
00104     after = True
00105 
00106   # This catches the special case of a closing brace having something
00107   # other than just whitespace ahead of it -- we don't want to
00108   # unindent that until after this line is printed so it stays with
00109   # the previous indentation level.
00110   if cnt < 0 and closing_prefix_re.match(stripline):
00111     after = True
00112   return (cnt, after)
00113 
00114 
00115 def prettyprint_input(lines):
00116   """Does the main work of indenting the input based on the brace counts."""
00117   indent = 0
00118   basic_offset = 2
00119   last_line = ""
00120   for line in lines:
00121     if COMMENT_RE.match(line):
00122       print line
00123     else:
00124       line = line.strip('\r\n\t ')  # Otherwise doesn't strip \r on Unix.
00125       if len(line) > 0:
00126         (brace_diff, after) = count_braces(line)
00127         if brace_diff != 0:
00128           if after:
00129             print " " * (basic_offset * indent) + line
00130             indent += brace_diff
00131           else:
00132             indent += brace_diff
00133             print " " * (basic_offset * indent) + line
00134         else:
00135           print " " * (basic_offset * indent) + line
00136       else:
00137         print ""
00138       last_line = line
00139 
00140 
00141 def main():
00142   if len(sys.argv) > 1:
00143     data = open(sys.argv[1]).read().splitlines()
00144   else:
00145     data = sys.stdin.read().splitlines()
00146   # Split up the double braces.
00147   lines = split_double_braces(data)
00148 
00149   # Indent and print the output.
00150   prettyprint_input(lines)
00151   return 0
00152 
00153 
00154 if __name__ == '__main__':
00155   sys.exit(main())
